fee_structure.engage_in_continuous_reflective_learning: Identify the need and scope of Interdisciplinary research.
Enhance research culture and uphold scientific integrity and objectivity.
Understand the professional, ethical and social responsibilities.
Understand the importance and the judicious use of technology for the sustainability of the environment.
Enhance disciplinary competency, employability and leadership skills.

why_choose: Why choose this course? Amalgam of knowledge on theoretical and applied Statistics Awareness of the conceptual framework of Statistics Practical training in Statistical methods Hands-on using sophisticated programming and statistical software Potential strength catered to industrial needs To get expertise for doctoral and competitive entrance exams of Statistical expertise
what_learn: What you will learn? Statistical principles and methods to solve real-world problems in real time. Stay updated on current industrial/research trends. Utilise suitable statistical techniques and software to assess real-world issues, presenting experiment results accurately. Improve skills as a statistician or data scientist for diverse career opportunities in science, government, finance, healthcare, tech, and more. To blend logical assumptions into scientific evidence for estimation and testing consequences To model and extract knowledge from both structured and non-structured data
modules: Modules Understanding theoretical aspects of probability measure and its distribution; Linear modelling - Regression and Time Series Methodology of Research - Problem identification and project proposal Year 1 Statistical programming and computation using Python, R and Java Reliability, Biostatistics and Machine Learning Analysis of survivability, design and quality Research implementation, publication and industrial project Year 2 Neural networks, deep learning and big data analytics Statistical genetics; actuarial methods and risk modelling; Bayesian-spatial-nonparametric inference
career: Career prospects Contemporary data analyst in finance, health care, marketing or technology, sports analytics and community risk management Statisticians who would design experiments, surveys, and data collection methods and develop statistical models Roles as machine learning engineers or data scientists Services national and international statistical agencies Careers in academia or research Internships and placements
